words.fact: Balance Sheet shows assets, liabilities, and equity at a specific point in time. It must always balance: Assets = Liabilities + Equity.
Income Statement shows revenues and expenses over a period. Also called Profit & Loss (P&L), it reveals whether the company made a profit or loss.
Cash Flow Statement tracks cash inflows and outflows from operating, investing, and financing activities. Cash is king in business!
Retained Earnings are cumulative profits kept in the business rather than paid as dividends. They connect the income statement to the balance sheet.
